Reviews.Title: A LOT for the money!
Reviews.Author: John S. Socha
Reviews.Content: I wrote the book "How To Use The Digital Camera Your Just Bought " (now on Amazon!), and I've dealt with hundreds of users and many, many cameras.For casual, all-around use, this is one of the nicest units I've worked with. The 16 MP resolution gives outstanding clarity and tone, plus you can crop if needed and still have enough left for a decent shot. While is does not have all the extras (aperture/shutter priority, manual, etc.) it DOES have what I consider essential controls: +/- exposure compensation and ISO to 1600.  These are found by going to "scenes" and selection "program." Then you can access them via onscreen display.Otherwise, choices are limited, but that's what a lot of people want.  You will want to get an external card reader, as it the camera is pretty locked in to the EasyShare system and I could not get a PC to "see" the camera when the software was not installed. However, with it installed you can send to Facebook, etc.It also can emulate the look of some older Kodak films such as Kodachrome and Tri-X.  This is fun for some old schoolers who miss the look of film.  A lot of good stuff for the money.This camera will NOT be good for far-away nature shots and indoor sports action shots. That requires higher end gear.  But for the casual and street photographer, it's pretty amazing and about as simplified as they currently get.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Taz
Reviews.Content: Compact size makes for easy carrying,takes very good pictures.Battery lasts a long time and with a 16gb card taking pictures all weekend is no problem.

Reviews.Title: Exactlly What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: ABF89
Reviews.Content: Does everything that I expected it to and more. Very compact, actually smaller than my phone, holds a charge for quite sometime, absolutely love it. The pictures are clearer than any other camera that I've ever had. Easy to use. Didn't even need to read the owners manual to understand all of the features.

Reviews.Title: Quite surprised actually
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: Most cameras in the under $100 price range are similar no matter which manufacturer you choose. I wanted a piece of Kodak history and I decided on the red camera, it's more of a metallic orange than red; I haven't seen many cameras this color but it looks great.I'm surprised by the substantial build quality of the camera.  It's heavier than I thought it would be for it being so small, and even though I'm sure it's plastic, it feels almost like aluminum. This Kodak has a robust feel to it that most cameras this price don't have.The battery/SD card door has a heavy-duty spring and it doesn't look like it will break unless you are extremely rough with your camera.  You can charge the lithium-ion battery inside the camera via the AC plug/power supply or by USB connection on your computer.The LCD screen is easy to see, even in daylight, the menus are very simple and easy to navigate, and I like the dedicated movie button on top of the camera, which eliminates having to dig down into the menus when capturing a video.  A printed manual comes with the camera, but the EasyShare software is stored inside the camera (which I don't care for but I work around it by using a card reader).There is no dedicated macro button, it's buried in a menu under the scenes, and then you choose "close-ups". I was surprised again at what good close-ups I can get with this camera, and it blurs the background like a much more expensive camera would do.Takes very good pictures and 720 HD movies, but the optical zoom will not work during a video.  Of course you can't expect optical zoom for a movie on a camera as cheap as this one. So for those of you reading this that want to know if you can optically zoom, well, no, you cannot - if you want optical zoom, you will have to zoom before you press the shutter button or physically move closer to the subject if possible.The zoom motor sounds strong, not like it may give out on me a month or so from now.This is an inexpensive camera I plan on carrying in my bag and if it breaks, so what? Yes, I know Kodak is getting out of the digital camera business but they are supporting the warranty for this camera for a year.  If you fear lack of support, you can always get a cheap warranty from Square Trade.  As much as I switch up my cameras from time-to-time, a one-year warranty is fine for me.

Reviews.Title: Appearance isn't enough
Reviews.Author: Jazzydivagrrl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my Kodak Easyshare V1233 which I absolutely love. (It is having issues.) I expected this newer model to offer higher quality with more bells and whistles. The specific swaying review stated "you can't take a blurry picture." How incredibly wrong. I have an entire birthday party of blurred photos. (Were there an option to post them...)Pros:Posed, still shots look great, but required patience.Sleek, snazzy look and feel.Excellent video - sound and picture quality.Cons:Lots of blurred shots. Unable to capture any moving moments clearly.Delay in focus, even after I changed the auto focus.Delay in shutter speed meant lots moments/shots.Shutter stuck. More lost shots."Smart capture" color is BRILLIANT! (Meaning very bright, garish)Slow "processing" caused even greater delays in shooting.Before I returned the camera, I changed the SD card to a faster speed, adjusted the scene settings, opted for custom on each occasion, began limiting use to only still photos. Since my intention was to photograph a four year old, at the beach, I was deeply disappointed with the product and its performance, in general. I was not a useful purchase for me.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M5350 camera - is good camera
Reviews.Author: marie
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Kodak Easyshare camera which is very similar.  Both cameras are very easy to use, small which I like because I carry it in my purse all the time.  It has all the. Features I need.  A good basic camera.

Reviews.Title: One Happy Grandson!
Reviews.Author: KatieJ
Reviews.Content: Our 8 year-old grandson desperately wanted a camera for Christmas. Several years ago we purchased our first digital camera and we chose a Kodak EasyShare after researching several different models. We were very happy with our choice so I looked to Kodak again. It was important to find a camera that would be rugged enough to withstand use by a child but it was important that it not look childish either. He is thrilled with his new camera and his mother reports that he has been taking pictures non-stop and is very happy with the ability to review his picture and decide whether or not to keep it. I think we have another budding photographer in the family! Very happy with this purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sara Kranpitz
Reviews.Content: I haven't dug into the features of this camera too much, but I used it right away as soon as I got it for my niece's birthday party and it was great.  It took perfect pictures even in the dark and was easy to figure out even without reading the directions.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: REVIEW FOR CAMERA
Reviews.Author: smfisher
Reviews.Content: Great customer service. Kodak Easyshare Digital camera is very friendly to use. I just love my new Kodak Easyshare Digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas present for my Wife.  It takes beautiful pictures, and she's very happy with it.  Delivery was flawless.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...both of mine broken down within 2 months
Reviews.Author: Guang Hong
Reviews.Content: I actually left a glowing review earlier when I first got the camera.  Love the low light, bright light and close up pictures that came out so well.....hence I have two of them. However, within 2 months both broke down: The lense would not retract no matter what I did.  One just happened one day, the other happened after the battery would not take charge.  I kept both of them in a camera bag in my purse and treated them like royalty, so they were not abused.  The quality is just not that good.  I can never trust Kodak cameras again.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price, Bit of a long preview.
Reviews.Author: Wild Wabbit
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera but the menu system is a bit slow even if someone is not accustomed to fast menu systems.  One thing that sort of irks me is that when a picture is taken it previews for 4 or 5 seconds and there's no way to turn it off or reduce it.  Why have such a long preview when one can play the pictures immediately afterwards?  Just seems like taking pictures of something turns out longer than expected.I don't use any of the Sharing features, just connect the camera with the Micro B cable and transfer while it charges.

Reviews.Title: kodak m5350
Reviews.Author: buei999
Reviews.Content: i love this model.this model is very easy to use and take very good foto and video.i think its best for this prise.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Kodak 16MP Camera!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Parks "Tech Extreme"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was small, but I found out it takes very good close up pictures.  Even my $450 Canon G11 had problems with pictures bending in the middle on close ups(known as pin cushioning).  Which is a sign of a cheap lens or bad software that doesn't correct internally, so the user never knows anyting different.  It also takes great low light pictures, but as usual, you need to hold still or it will be blurry.  Also, at 16MP, you can really blow up the picture to 13 x 19 size and it looks just as good as a 4 x 6.  I wish it had more controls, but really...I probably wouldn't use them anyway :)  The video is also pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this camera, from a former Canon/Nikon/Pentax user
Reviews.Author: ilflgirl
Reviews.Content: I have always used Japanese brand cameras like Nikon, Canon, etc.  When my last Canon went out of commission, I found this camera after a quick search.  I use it to take outdoor scenic pictures and close ups for my ebay store.  Both worked out beautifully!  A plesant surprise: it works very well in low light conditions like stage shows and indoors.  In those conditions it can get a little blurry if you do not rest your hand and wrist somewhere--but again, low light should be blamed not the camera.  The pictures are awesome as long as you give your hands stable support.  It let you choose "bright" for conditions like the beach, and "close ups" for my ebay pictures, all with easy to use buttons.  Only flaw is the "easy share" software on my computer: it shows up every time I put the SD card in the computer card slot.  I prefer manu sharing rather than Kodak's quick sharing, so the software seem a little pesky.  Other than that I just love, love, love this camera--it has everything my Canon has and so much more.  I bought two, was going to return one of them, but decided to keep both in the end.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Tina Lynn Himelstein
Reviews.Content: The features and settings work beautifully on this camera. It takes clear hi-def images and video, and after a while of having it I'm glad that I bought it from Amazon at a low cost. It would cost more anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price....
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a upgrade to my older Kodak camera and this seemed like a good option.  I do like the features and the quality is great but any movement and the picture will blur.  It could be user error but I have tried several things with the same result.On the small tripod it is great and the picures and video are crystal clear.  The audio on the video is also very clear and a lot better than expected.

Reviews.Title: GREAT AND SIMPLE
Reviews.Author: Elenita Gillaspy
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was simple to use-point and take.  This is the camera! I have some very pricey cameras that take great pictures but just to much of a bother, this is point and click and see great results-Thank u!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the camera my husband had order for my birthday. I wanna thank y'all so much.

Reviews.Title: love!
Reviews.Author: kell
Reviews.Content: 2nd time i bought this camera because i lost the first one. great value. share button is a nice feature love it.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Redneckbiker
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my mother in law, who's previous easyshare camera had died. Her budget was under a $100 and this way by far the best buy! My wife and I just had a baby and she took a ton of photos with it. My wife and I used our iPhone 4s cameras. We had a bunch of the photos printed and hers turned out way better. The photos she took were not grainy and were full of color. We just ended up ordering another camera for my wife and I! One thing I was impressed with this camera is that it uses a microUSB charger and cable. Not the funky small square one that Kodak used for years and years. I highly recommend this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: well worth the price
Reviews.Author: A. Olinger
Reviews.Content: great little camera for the price. takes a really high quality picture for such a lightweight camera. not cheap or chintzy. highly satisfied with my purchase. this is all 90% of people need for a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Positively surprised
Reviews.Author: Paulina
Reviews.Content: I was a bit scared of ordering this camera after some negative reviews, but I think I made a good choice. I am no photographer, in fact this is the first camera I ever purchased for myself. I just wanted a camera which would take nice pictures of my friends, family and from hikes and at the same time didn't require me to learn anything about settings. It turns out this item is perfect for my needs. There are several modes to choose from, when you highlight one, a short note appears which tells you when the mode is appropriate. I find it very convenient. I took this camera to a hike in a forest on a very cloudy day and got really nice pictures of both landscape and some close-ups of flowers. I think people who complained about blurry pictures did not change the mode to the appropriate one (e.g. without setting my camera to "close-up" while photographing tiny flowers I also got blurry pics). Just to test the camera I took some picture of one compound I synthesized in my research project. I was very surprised that the pictures not only turned out very well, regardless of very bad artificial light in the lab, but also revealed tiny crystals formed in the beaker, which were not visible with a naked eye (again, I used the close-up mode).I also like a lot the case the camera came with, it's very practical.I strongly recommend this camera to anyone who needs user friendly but still a good one. I am going to upload some photos I took later, so that you can judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: Do not pay extra for the big name brands like Nikon and canon. This camera is very easy to use and is just as nice as the big name brands.

Reviews.Title: What I wanted
Reviews.Author: H. Sleaviin "Kris"
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera. Easy to use and easy to upload to my computer. My only problem with it is that taking a picture is a bit hard. I haven't gotten the hang of it.For example, I click the button and a green light shines. No picture is taken so I press twice really fast and two photos are taken. Also, the card it came with has verry little room. I think it can only hold 6 pictures - but for the price I guess it's reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Low quality
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I have quit using this camera ever since I got my smart phone. My 8mp phone camera consistently takes better pictures. When I took pictures with the flash everything had a white tint or brightness to it and colors were all blended. No flash usually produced a blurry photo. If you are taking mostly outdoor shots with natural light then this camera may be for you.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Merv Scott
Reviews.Content: Clarity of pictures is very good. Flash could improve. Need a good computer program which can lighten, darken. improve contrast, color, and shadows. Camera has taken several hundred pictures so far with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Safe Shipping. Perfect transaction. A+++++++++++++++++++++
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Hallmark
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Takes great pictures every time even in less than perfect lighting.  No blurry pics and no too dark pics.

Reviews.Title: Just received today
Reviews.Author: Trisha Morriston "Nero Wolfe and Journey Fan"
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera today. Mom absoutely loves it. Got this as a belated Mother's Day Gift. Great gift idea.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Karen B. Bobadilla
Reviews.Content: It's easy to use, great pictures. I bought it for a family vacation trip. It's very portable and fits in jean pockets. The pictures are great, even at the same level as professional pictures.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share M5350
Reviews.Author: addicted2chickens
Reviews.Content: Love the camera for all the settings.Takes great photos.The thing I dont like is it slow.Dont plan on taking lots of action shots with this camera.takes almost a full 30-40 seconds between picture taken and it being ready to take another picture.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: runfor4
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great.  It takes high quality photos. It is lightweight and easy to use.  I bought this for my daughter and use it instead of my 12 MP Sony.  Plus the red color is pretty. :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent clarity
Reviews.Author: Mr. Thomas Bromhead "tombrom"
Reviews.Content: I have owned about 5 digital cameras, for its size, this is amazing.It has a fantastic photo stitch function for panoramas.The pictures are incredibly clear and colors are spot on.It is a little slow to save and get ready for next pic, but got to be some sacrifices for size.This camera continues to amaze me.

Reviews.Title: exelente compra
Reviews.Author: jose
Reviews.Content: exelente compra en buenas condiciones llego la camara. muy buena, complacido con el producto adquirido al 100% no tengo ninguan que queja

Reviews.Title: WORK FOR LESS THAN 6 MONTHS
Reviews.Author: JAMAICANPRN
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR A VACATION TRIP AND WAS TOLD KODAK WAS A GOOD BRAND, DURING OUR VACATION IT WORKED GREAT. THE CAMERA SAT IN THIS BOX AFTER THAT FOR ABOUT 4 MONTHS. I WENT TO USE THE CAMERA FOR MY SISTER BABY SHOWER AND IT WOULD NOT TURN ON. I CONTACTED KODAK OVER 10 TIMES THEY WHERE NO HELP, ONCE I DID FIND SOMEONE TO HELP ME I WAS TOLD TO SEND THEM THE CAMERA WHICH I DID. A MONTH AFTER SENDING THE CAMERA THEY CALL ME TO LET ME KNOW THAT RUST WAS FOUND INSIDE THE CAMERA??????? A BRAND NEW CAMERA USED ONLY ONCE, NO HELP DONT WATSE YOUR MONEY YOU MIGHT GET A DUD CAMERA, NEVER EVER AGAIN WILL I ORDER ANY THING OF KODAK

Reviews.Title: its ok
Reviews.Author: chuckie
Reviews.Content: its very small i was expecting a bigger camera its about as small as a smart phone or smallerthe i phone is biggerbut if u like small cameras that take good pics youll love this

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed
Reviews.Author: Edward Bremson "eddie80"
Reviews.Content: I already owned an Easyshare M575, 14mp, 5x zoom, and I thought this would be a better camera. It was not as good as the M575. 1. This camera is slow. You miss a lot of action photos because of its slowness getting itself ready to shoot. 2. This camera is not as good in low light situations. 3. The picture quality is not that much better than the 14mp model to justify this purchase.I wish I had gone for a 10 or 15x zoom instead, like Nikon 8200. Nikon Coolpix also says that it is a faster camera. There is nothing more frustrating photographically than to have the camera prevent you from taking a photo you want to take. That has happened many times with the Easyshare.Sure, Easyshare is a good point and shoot camera which gives good photos, but sometimes it is just time to upgrade. This camera is not an upgrade from what I had. :((

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I ever had
Reviews.Author: Mary "Mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: I love cameras and have a bunch of them. I bought this because it had a higher number of MP than my others and I liked how small it was. Well, I shouldn't have. It's awful.I read reviews here of people saying that no matter what they did they couldn't take a bad picture with it. I've had the opposite. No matter what I do, I can't take a good picture with it. Most of them are blurry, especially inside, even if the flash is on. Right now I am deleting pictures that I took off the camera, and no joke, it is taking over 8 minutews already and it's still not done.The only reason it gets 2 stars is because it takes decent video. Other than that, it's junk. I will stick to my Sony Cybershot and my Nikon SLR from now on.

Reviews.Title: very slow in processing
Reviews.Author: grace
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April 2012 to replace our older kodak easyshare because the buttons didnt work properly anymore to go through the menus.I chose this model because I love the panoramic feature where it immediately stitches 3 pictures together, and the video mode where you can start recording instantly and make pictures of the filming later.as it turns out, this camera is incredibly slow after taking a picture it really needs a long time before you can take a 2nd picture. that is really sad, because you miss all the important moments. It just shows "processing" the entire time.Also, if you switch the camera on and you want to "quickly" show some pictures to your friends, it can take up to a minute before the pictures are shown, and in my experience it even freezes sometimes where i take out the battery to shut it off.my old Kodak had the feature where it shows a hand in the top corner after taking a picture, red, yellow or green, depending on if your picture turned out blurry, a little bit blurry or if it is in focus. this is something I miss, because a lot of pictures turn out blurry when you see them later on the computer, although they looked kindof ok on the camera screen.not at all what I expected when i bought my new toy.i tend to keep using the old camera again because of this.I checked online if maybe there is an update to be done on the software, but so far I haven't found anything.I don't recommend this camera although I am a Kodak fan.

Reviews.Title: my new kodak camera
Reviews.Author: ronnyb
Reviews.Content: So far my girlfriend is very content with her gift. Does everything its supposed to, takes brilliant pics. No complaints besides the fact  I read in other reviews that other people got a carrying case with theirs and I didnt. Simple to understand,easy to store and carry,nice color,lightweight.

Reviews.Title: cheap
Reviews.Author: arichsrds
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in January and the screen broke in early may last me less then 5 months, the camera was not dropped or spilled on and kodak will not replace it. I would have to pay $35 just for them to look at it. I am extremely disappointed in kodaks customer service. would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and delivery
Reviews.Author: mmd
Reviews.Content: Fastest shipping ever by Foresst Electronics! It came in perfect condition. The camera is great. Pictures are clear and crisp and video is in HD. Color looks more like orange though, not red. All the same, I like it! Thanks :)

Reviews.Title: Blurry, out of focus, incorrect colors, Locks up
Reviews.Author: Billfog "Billfog"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the 5 star reviews and I simply dont know what they are talking about.I tried this camera out for a week before returning it.Pros.I really liked the design.The ease of use, I was able to hand it to people that never saw it before and they could take pictures without having to tell them what to do.Kodachrome selection was awesome if you are like me and am nostalgic about Kodachrome.The separate Video button is something every cam should have.Micro USB cable for charging or connecting to the computer. No special proprietary cable needed.Cons.7 out of 10 pictures I took were blurry or out of focus.Colors were tinted wrong in many cases.Camera locked up several times forcing me to remove the battery and losing the video or picture I had taken.The auto focus light was bright and green. Creeped just about everyone out and caused natural scenes to be spoiled by everyone stopping what they were doing and looking at the camera with the teleporting ray aimed at them.Summary.I took about 110 pictures with this camera and only about 10 came out decent and only to the level of decent. In my opinion my old samsung rant cell phone takes pics and videos of only slightly lower qualityI was very bummed because even though the camera is not made in the USA I at least wanted to by a camera from an American company like Kodak.I returned this and got the Samsung PL120 and it is great in comparison. The Samsung bad/good pic ratio the exact opposite of this camera. Whereas most pics are great

Reviews.Title: A lot of good stuff... But..
Reviews.Author: Ascaris
Reviews.Content: Camera takes really stunning pictures. You really get a lot for your money and even more. I've had this camera for 2 months already and all and all I love it.... For the most part.I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the freezing problem this camera has. Sometimes I have to take the battery out just so I can restart the camera..But that means loosing the picture it has been trying to "Process" and save. I wouldn't mind an occasional freezing  but it happens too much for my liking...If you really want a nice camera with a lot of punch without breaking the bank, this would be a good choice... I'm sure there are better choices out there... But it really takes breath taking pictures, especially at 16 mp setting.

Reviews.Title: Their best camera yet!
Reviews.Author: Karen "world traveler"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Kodak digital cameras and by far this is the most impressive. Admittedly I had one that I could not see the screen anytime I was outdoors. Recently I was in the desert (i.e.bright sun) with this camera and could ALWAYS see what I was taking a picture of. Clear, beautiful pictures combined with the ease up uploading to Kodak Gallery etc with one click make it the perfect camera in my mind. I also love the placement of all the buttons better than any camera I have previously owned. Ordering two more to give as gifts.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Marinemom
Reviews.Content: After doing some research and reading the reviews I always fall back to a great product....Kodak. Kodak cameras seem to last longer than any other camera and has everything I was looking for. The pictures are crisp and clear, easy to charge battery, is user friendly very light weight and compact. It is an every day use camera. I was surprised at how small it was but the advantage to that is it will go anywhere easily. We have recently added four of these to our family. I ordered one for my husband for Christmas. My son also received one from his Grandmother. They love it! After seeing how wonderful it takes pictures my daughter-n-law ordered one for herself in January. I received the best price, at $64, as I just ordered a red one for myself! Best little camera for every day use!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: BH
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for every day use. Haven't taken it on vacation yet, just taken pictures of family & pets; good quality. small, easy to use, seems to have long battery life (which is great). Good price, great photos-just what most people would need, unless you are a professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: Flash won't work
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Baron "mark3905"
Reviews.Content: I had this for less than a year, and the first time I tried to use it in a dark environment, the flash won't work.  Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Tremendous camera!!
Reviews.Author: Domingo Osorio
Reviews.Content: The design and size of the great camera, the HD video great, very sharp! surprised by the inclusion of memory and case included! satisfied with your purchase!!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth it.
Reviews.Author: Jose Gabriel Espinoza "gabriele"
Reviews.Content: As soon as I received the camera, I got a "lens obstructed" message rendering the camera unoperable.Additionally, the autofocus function is not accurate, and you'll find yourself composing the picture several times before finally shooting.A real dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: indymom52
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just a couple of months ago and it took decent pictures for only a couple of days. Now I have to take the same picture several times as the first several attempts are blurry. Without changing any settings or the way I take a picture the picture comes out horribly 3 out of 4 times. The pictures are also dark despite being taken outside or with a flash. Kodak customer service is unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: Alright, until mnow.
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong, this camera took amazing pictures. Then, one day, my camera just froze. It wont turn off, nor on. It just sits there now with no purpose. get a better camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
16 megapixels
5X Wide Optical Zoom
2.7" Bright LCD
Kodak?s Smart Capture Technology
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M5350 Digital Camera (Red)
